course.subject: COMP
course.name: Java Programming Bridging Course
course.description: This course introduces the Java programming language. It is intended for students who already have some experience in computer programming but wish to learn how to apply those programming skills to the Java language. The course covers basic programming topics such as variables, control statements, loops, functions, and object-oriented programming concepts. Students explore these by self-learning of course materials together with guided programming exercises. Students without the prerequisites but possess relevant programming knowledge may seek instructor's approval for enrolling in the course. Graded P or F.
course.prerequisites: COMP 1021 OR COMP 1022Q (prior to 2020-21) OR ISOM 3230
course.exclusions: COMP 1022P, COMP 3021, ISOM 3320

reviews.author: PeterNg
reviews.title: Foundation of Java Programming
reviews.comment_content: Some basic java language learning via BlueJ, you would learn text input/output, looping, class. array, file input/output. In the last chapter, the course would introduce a programme called Greenfoot, it s used to make a fun game.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course explained codes clearly through text and pictures. Besides, some example is also provided for you to download and study. Apart from regular mandatory assignments,  you could also finish some extra review questions.
Gibson is a star wars fans, the exam contain so many questions associated to star wars. That s really out of my expectation.XD
reviews.comment_grading:
Only pass or fail.
You would be able to pass as long as you got a total of 60% for assignments part and 40% for exam part. Exam is pretty easy, most of the questions are focusing on the output of coding, so you don't need to memorise and 'spell' some long code.
reviews.comment_workload: Since this course is founded for students who have studied Comp1022Q/P,  just follow the step they suggested, assignments should not be a big deal. You might got some problem, but solving it is not difficult, just spend 3-4 hours per week and you would be able to deal with the assignments nicely. If you really can't finish the assignment, there is a video guid you.

reviews.author: Dok
reviews.comment_content:
Basic intro course to Java programming.
It teaches you the basic syntax of the language.
The course uses BlueJ (3 labs) and Greenfoot (1 lab).
Nothing difficult at all; if you had past programming experience and are willing to learn programming on your own, you're good to go.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Combination of online reading lectures and video labs.
Basically it's all self-learning by yourself.
Going through the lectures is not graded, but you have to submit a lab every 2 or so weeks, which is graded (need 60%+ total).
reviews.comment_grading:
You need 60%+ in labs, and 40%+ in the final exam.
Extremely easy to pass.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 labs (exercises) + 1 final exam.
Each lab took me maybe 15 minutes max. Easy. Just follow the TA's video if you're stuck because he literally walks you through the answers.
Final exam is 1 hour long. I didn't study for it at all, but basic programming knowledge will be able to get you a pass (40%), because the questions ask stuff like if/else, recursion, data types etc things you already learn from other courses, not strictly specific to Java.

reviews.author: IP protocol
reviews.title: Simple self-learning basic Java course
reviews.comment_content:
Learning about basic Java programming which features the use of  BlueJ and Greenfoot. Suitable for those who are interested in learning Java and are looking for a starting point to dive into the Java world. Not suitable for those who have already learned the basics and looking for advanced content.

Rough syllabus:
1. Data types, operators, use of Java package
2. Print text and get input from users
3. If, Switch
4. For loop, While loop, Do While loop
5. Object-oriented programming in Java(class, method, instance)
6. Array in Java
7. Inheritance & Interface
8. Types of error, catching exceptions
9. Using path, read and write a file
10. Recursion
11. Greenfoot section(making a game)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Self-learning, self-pacing. You need to read through the materials on Canvas on your own. The amount of material is not heavy, about 3-4 sections every week with several examples. If you are hardworking enough, learning through all of these would be a piece of cake. Recommend actually downloading BlueJ and Greenfoot and following the examples to have a better understanding.
If you could not push yourself to study on your own, this course may not suit you.
reviews.comment_grading:
A Pass or Fail course. If you achieve:
1. Submitting at least 3 homework and having good scores among them
2. Getting at least 40% on the final exam
Then you would pass the course.

About the final exam:
1. Open book, open notes. So do not hesitate to make some cheat sheets to bring to your exam.
2. Mixed with MCs and Short Questions. Does not require you to write a whole program on your own suddenly.
3. Most questions are straightforward and basic. Don't be stressed - Getting 40% is all you need!
reviews.comment_workload:
Very little workload. Only 3-4 pieces of material to learn every week, along with 1 piece of homework.

About the homework :
1. Gave you a template. You only need to fill in specific parts, just like in COMP1021.
2. Only 3-4 simple tasks. You may check your program with the given example.
3. Most of the part is copied and pasted from the example. If not, from the previous learning material. You may always find TA  for help if you really could not figure it out.
4. Make sure you check the requirement carefully.
5. Make sure you submit the correct file. (.java or .zip, depending on the homework)

reviews.author: SmokingPuddle58
reviews.title: A simple bridge to Java
reviews.comment_content:
The contents are good but not very deep, which include some basics of Java, basic OOP, Error handling, File I/O, and probably the least useful: Greenfoot.

The course suggests you to use BlueJ for a better visualization of classes and methods but I prefer to use vscode. Still you need to know how to use BlueJ as there are exam questions on BlueJ.
reviews.comment_teaching: There's no teaching at all. You just go through the canvas pages and read the materials yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
Easy to pass the course. Just get >60% on assignment and >40%  on final exam (which should be open book) .

I got 3/4 assignment full mark and 1 assignment 0 mark because I submitted the wrong file, and I got 72% in final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: It's a 1-credit course so there's really not much workload. Every assignments can be finished within 2 hours with the guidelines from the assignment.

reviews.author: JDC
reviews.title: Easy and no stress
reviews.comment_content:
Content is just a very simple introduction to java, designed for someone with no experience. Uses BlueJ and GreenFoot, not practical but good for beginners to visualise what they're making.

The content is presented on Canvas, and is very easy to get through (only takes like an hour maximum). There are five of these pages overall, which results in only a few hours of content for a full semester. However, this is probably in line with most other 1-credit courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: There is no teacher for the course, so cannot say. I hear Gibson is a good one though.
reviews.comment_grading: It is a pass/fail course so the grading is no problem. Passing involved the exam and assignments which are both very easy to do well in.
reviews.comment_workload:
Basically non-existent. The final exam takes like an hour of revision to pass, and was quite easy. The assignments are all quite straightforward, and just use what you've learnt from the canvas pages.
There is around a few hours of work in this course that you need to do, so very good, can finish the entire course's content in a day.

reviews.author: 15Df54848
reviews.title: Like a book with exercise
reviews.comment_content: It is a course which will bring you through the basics of java, like hello world, basic data handling and stuff. 5 Lessons in total, you will have spare time to finish each of them with half-a-day. Starting from lesson 4, you will learn some basic of OOP, which includes Inheritance, Interfaces, error handling, file input and output or even coordinate handling in a 2D world. But again, easy stuff, what do you expect from a 1-credit course and the best grade you can get is a Pass.
reviews.comment_teaching: Learn by yourself, only words are there to read and thus to teach. If you are really really struggling, you could contact TA -- Google. There're actually some real TAs and I'd say Google could do the job much faster.
reviews.comment_grading: Easy to pass, impossible to get A. You only need to identify the syntax errors in the codes in the final. And in some extreme cases, a dry run table will get you through all the problems.
reviews.comment_workload: I didn't expect to create 5 programs in a 1-credit course, so I rate it a C.

reviews.author: idkwhypm
reviews.title: A self study course
reviews.comment_content:
The content is easy and more concentrates on the usage of blueJ.
BuleJ is helpful
reviews.comment_teaching: There is no lecture and we are required to do self studying. You can ask the TA for help if you have questions.
reviews.comment_grading: It is a p/f course. Programming exercises: submit and obtain 60% or higher of the four exercises total mark. That means you could submit three out of four exercises and still pass the requirement, given that you get very good marks for them. Final examination: obtain 40% or higher in the final exam
reviews.comment_workload: There is little workload.What you need to do is illustrated clearly.

reviews.author: Dicaprio
reviews.title: Easy Pass/Fail Course
reviews.comment_content:
Am I the only one who thought this can be counted in the best 24 cred in the major selection and enrolled in this course? 🤔 (It is P/F so it don't count :P)

Simple Java using BlueJ and Greenfoot.
learn it yourself by reading the notes on Canvas. It is a Canvas page, not pdf files. There are 5 parts. Part 2~5 have a homework in the end so 4 homework in total. He unlocks 1 part every month and the homework is due before he unlocks the next part so you can't finish learning everything at once.
reviews.comment_teaching: The homework and example are easy to follow through and clear to read. but I wonder if I can remember anything after the final exam. :P So, I didn't rate it an A for teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is just a Pass/Fail Course and I don't think there is anyone who failed this course

He literally wrote “There are enough easy problems to let you reach the passing mark (40%)” in the final exam. (it is an open book exam so think about it)
reviews.comment_workload: One part of notes and one homework per month. 3 hours per month will be enough. per month not per week so the workload is very light.

reviews.author: Vincentchan9839
reviews.title: System.out.println("Easy course! Even Year 1 students can pass this course easily!");
reviews.comment_content:
Lesson 1 - Introduction to Java
Lesson 1.1 - Using Java and BlueJ
Lesson 1.2 - Java Language Basics
Lesson 1.3 - Variables and Operators
Lesson 1.4 - Text Input and Output

Lesson 2 - Essential Programming in Java
Lesson 2.1 - Using Strings
Lesson 2.2 - Making Decisions
Lesson 2.3 - Loops

Lesson 3 - Object-oriented Programming and Arrays
Lesson 3.1 - Basic Object-oriented Programming
Lesson 3.2 - Class Methods
Lesson 3.3 - Arrays

Lesson 4 - Advanced Topics
Lesson 4.1 - Inheritance and Interfaces
Lesson 4.2 - Error Handling
Lesson 4.3 - File Input and Output
Lesson 4.4 - Recursion

Lesson 5 - Using Greenfoot
Lesson 5.1 - Using Greenfoot
Lesson 5.2 - Creating a Spaceship in a Game
Lesson 5.3 - Creating an Enemy in the Game
Lesson 5.4 - Finishing the Game
reviews.comment_teaching:
No face to face lesson.

All the teaching materials are on Canvas. Read all of them by yourselves.

I have asked the professor for a few times. His explanations are pretty well. Usually, he will reply you in less than 24 hours.

Just make sure you do enough hand-in exercise and do normally in exam to get enough score to pass.

There are also some review questions that you may do. However, they will not counted towards your final grade and it is optional for you to do them.
reviews.comment_grading:
This is a Pass/Fail course. To pass the course, you need to:

1.
Programming exercises:
submit and obtain 60% or higher of the four exercises total mark. That means you could submit three out of four exercises and still pass the requirement, given that you get very good marks for them.

2.
Final examination:
obtain 40% or higher in the final exam.


The final exam contains 20 questions. It lasts for 1 hour. Some of the questions are multiple-choice questions and some of them are short questions. The exam is open book and open notes (digital or paper-based).


My result:

Exercise for Lesson 2 (ASCII to Emoji) :
100/100

Exercise for Lesson 3 (Dim Sum Ordering System) :
100/100

Exercise for Lesson 4 (A Phone Book Program) :
100/100

Exercise for Lesson 5 (A Shooting Game) :
100/100

Final Exam :
87/100

Grade: P

(For your reference, I took COMP1021 in 2021-2022 Fall and I got A+ at last.)

I also got Level 5* in 2021 HKDSE ICT. My elective is Software Development. The programming language I learned in secondary school was C.

In the same semester (2021-2022 Winter), I also took COMP1029C because the syntax of both languages are quite similar, and I pass all these courses eventually.)
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light. I took this course when I was Year 1.

Just make sure you hand in your work before the deadline, and do some revision before the final exam, you will get a pass.

If you do not have anything to do in winter semester, I highly recommend you to enroll this course so that you can learn something meaningful.

reviews.author: 準雷
reviews.title: 輕鬆拎credit又學到少少野既P/F course
reviews.comment_content:
Lesson 1 - Introduction to Java
Lesson 1.1 - Using Java and BlueJ
Lesson 1.2 - Java Language Basics
Lesson 1.3 - Variables and Operators
Lesson 1.4 - Text Input and Output

Lesson 2 - Essential Programming in Java
Lesson 2.1 - Using Strings
Lesson 2.2 - Making Decisions
Lesson 2.3 - Loops

Lesson 3 - Object-oriented Programming and Arrays
Lesson 3.1 - Basic Object-oriented Programming
Lesson 3.2 - Class Methods
Lesson 3.3 - Arrays

Lesson 4 - Advanced Topics
Lesson 4.1 - Inheritance and Interfaces
Lesson 4.2 - Error Handling
Lesson 4.3 - File Input and Output
Lesson 4.4 - Recursion

Lesson 5 - Using Greenfoot
Lesson 5.1 - Using Greenfoot
Lesson 5.2 - Creating a Spaceship in a Game
Lesson 5.3 - Creating an Enemy in the Game
Lesson 5.4 - Finishing the Game
reviews.comment_teaching:
所有材料擺哂上Canvas
唔會用任何face to face堂
自己搵時間睇就得
Concept都解釋得好清楚
Example都足夠
淺白易明
reviews.comment_grading:
P/F Course
4份Exercise總分最少要60%
Final Exam總分最少要40%

Exercise for Lesson 2 (ASCII to Emoji): 100/100
Exercise for Lesson 3 (Dim Sum Ordering System): 100/100
Exercise for Lesson 4 (A Phone Book Program): 100/100
Exercise for Lesson 5 (A Shooting Game): 100/100

Final Exam: 77/100

Grade: P
reviews.comment_workload:
[我係winter讀所以會有dd唔同]
Total有4份exercise
頭3個exercise係整d application
最尾1個exercise就係整一個小遊戲
平均一個星期一份exercise要做
如果諗唔到點做可能要用多少少時間研究下
個template已經做好一部份
基本上只係fill in the blanks

考試係online + open book
一個鐘20題
臨考前一晚睇一睇D syntax用法就ok
會有MC題同fill in the blanks

總括而言個workload唔大

reviews.author: Ast.
reviews.comment_content:
Using BlueJ / Greenfoot to write some simple program.
The content are just similar to other programming language, nothing really special.
reviews.comment_teaching:
online self-study without lessons, so no comment.
You will be provided notes for the course (maybe with video sometimes).
reviews.comment_grading:
Only P/F for this course. If you can finish all the assignment and doing the final exam, you would probably get a pass for this course.
Required a passing mark in both assignment and final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
-Online notes
-Assignments()
-Final exam

You may need to spend some time reading the notes before you do the exercise or assignments.

Assignment: 2.5~3.5 week per assignment

Final exam: close-book exam. Just for getting a passing mark to pass the course, so it's not hard at all

BUT!!!
This course may still be a burden during Spring/Fall sem. Taking this course during winter/summer maybe a better option.

reviews.author: hjmu
reviews.title: Light Introduction to Java
reviews.comment_content: An intro course to Java programming, starting from basic syntax to preliminary OOP. The course is on BlueJ and Greenfoot, both are easy to handle. Just follow step by step and nothing will be difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: Self-learning... Nice slides by the way.
reviews.comment_grading:
pass and fail only.
>60 % in the lab
>40% in the final
reviews.comment_workload: Well, you can complete the slides and quizzes of the week altogether in 2 hours or less. Half a day of review before the exam will be enough to get it passed.  No extra effort is required.

reviews.author: tyj
reviews.comment_content: Quite simple with prior programming experience but nice to get a feel of the JAVA language.
reviews.comment_teaching:
No personal teaching, just read the course website. Projects are provided for each topic to exemplify the point.
TA marks the assignment but with minimal feedback.
reviews.comment_grading:
Complete a minimum number out of all assignments and achieve at least 40% in finals.

Assignments are simple as step-by-step instructions are given. The final assignment is a bit longer but still very detailed instructions with a video from Gibson.

The final is quite simple especially if you have experience with COMP 1021 style exams. Less about JAVA syntax, more on programming concepts.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload, on average half an hour per week. Only five lessons in the entire semester. Since this is a P/F subject, not much revision required for finals also.

reviews.author: LukaModric
reviews.title: To be updated
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction to Java
Using Java and BlueJ:
The Java Programming Language
Developing Java
The BlueJ Development Environment
Running Your First Program
Using BlueJ Without Installation

Java Language Basics:
Java Statements
Code Blocks
Writing Comments
Java Packages

Variables and Operators:
Using Variables
Storing Different Things into Variables
Using Data Types
Operators

Text Input and Output:
Printing Text
Printing Variables
Getting Input from Users


2. Essential Programming in Java
Using Strings:
Converting Strings to Other Data Types
Looking into the Content of Strings

Making Decisions:
if and else
Switch Statement

Loops:
For Loops
While Loops
Do While Loops

3. Object-oriented Programming and Arrays
Basic Object-oriented Programming:
The Object Bench
Using a Class

Class Methods:
Putting Methods in a Class
Class Constructor
The main Method

Arrays:
Two Dimensional Arrays
Finding the Length of an Array

4. Advanced Topics
Inheritance and Interfaces:

Error Handling:
Types of Errors
Exceptions
Catching exceptions

File Input and Output:
Path object
Using methods from the files class
Reading text file
Writing text file

Recursion:
Recursion on strings

5. Using Greenfoot
Using Greenfoot:
Creating a new world
Creating a new actor

Creating a spaceship in a game:
Adding spaceship
Making player move
Turning player using keyboard
Finishing player control

Creating enemy in a game:
Creating actor
Moving the actor randomly
Automatically removing the actor
Adding the actor randomly

Finishing the game:
Collision between actors
Using the list object
Stopping the game
Showing an explosion
reviews.comment_teaching:
Online study.
With review questions and answers.
Average 1 week per 1 section; total 5 sections
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Submit >=3 exercises out of 4
2. Get >=60% marks of exercises in total
3. Get >=40% marks of final exam
Then Pass
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light.
Used 1-2 hrs for doing each exercises.
Closed-book exam on 25/7.

reviews.author: Stan1ey
reviews.comment_content:
The content is about the essential Java code.
The course covers topics like Loops, Functions, Arrays, Strings, Structures, Recursion, File Input and Output. The course will introduce some program such as Greenfont and BlueJ to write JAVA.
reviews.comment_teaching: The course explained codes clearly through text and pictures. It is an online course, you can go to Youtube and watch the video
reviews.comment_grading:
pass and fail only.
You need to get >60 % in the lab
and >40% in the final to pass the course.
But it is not difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: The work load is pretty light as most of the student has some programming background. You can follow the step and complete the program very easy.

reviews.author: cywongbr
reviews.comment_content:
java language 的基本東西, 跟其它language 差不多, 所以不算難

不過因為跟其它language差不多, 有時可能會搞混不同language的寫法
reviews.comment_teaching: 要自己看網頁學習, 寫得挺清楚, 亦有example 可以讓人跟著試一次
reviews.comment_grading: 只要有跟著影片做功課, 考試40分就可以pass, 很容易就達標
reviews.comment_workload:
一星期一份功課,共4份, 有影片教, 基本上跟著做就ok
workload 不算大

因為內容跟其它language差不多, 考試只要之前看過notes,對java
language 的寫法有印象就可以pass

reviews.author: aoi0071
reviews.comment_content:
the course covers topics like Loops, Functions, Arrays, Strings, Structures, Recursion, File Input and Output.
you will learn to use BlueJ and Greenfoot
reviews.comment_teaching:
very good
there are many example provided
and the topics are explained clearly
the instruction of the exercise is detailed and also easy to understand
reviews.comment_grading:
only pass or fail
need to at least submit 3 assignments and take the final exam and
achieve 60% for the four assignments and 40% for the final exam to pass the course
reviews.comment_workload:
need to submit 4 assignments
once a week
if you don't know how to do the assignment, you can watch the video
it will teach you step by step

reviews.author: GYHL
reviews.title: 輕鬆pass
reviews.comment_content:
1029系列既另一個online course 同幾他online comp course大同小異
呢個course主要係教java language 用BlueJ同Greenfoot 去寫

一開始都係教下printline scanner果d 然後有d loop 同埋file operation
最後會教你係greenfoot寫下小遊戲咁 整體唔錯

順帶一提 mech好似有科avionics(唔似有冇記錯)既pre-requisite 要讀java 冇讀1022p既同學記得讀呢個啦
reviews.comment_teaching:
online course 所有野都係web base
解釋算清晰 有唔同既example 既code比你down落黎compile試下
不過有一樣好不滿既係  course material係一個web page所以唔可以好似一個pdf 咁down落黎 姐係完左sem你keep唔到d notes
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail
功課要有6成
Exam要有4成
基本上好難fail
reviews.comment_workload:
summer/winter會比較大 平均一星期一個homework
但係有youtube片guide住你做  基本上睇住gibson跟住做就ok

course material都幾多字同examples 建議用d時間go through一次 exam會有把握好多(雖然有少少底的話又真係幾難冇4成)
